page.title: 02Trays Farm,Compton Dundon
page.content: Trays Farm is situated up a small hill in Compton Dundon and is owned by Mr and Mrs Napper. It covers 180 acres of grassland and is a dairy farm with 90 Friesian cows and a few heifers kept for beef. They employ one man from the village as well as their two sons and combine with another farm for silage making, so avoiding the need for employing other workers at certain times in the year. The farm has a great deal of equipment including four tractors and trailers, one forage harvester and one bailer.If all their machinery was bought new it would be worth Â£90,000. The farmhouse itself is 350 years old with a 12th Century chapel and a 17th Century barn on the side.
